        Clinix Healthcare has 40 years of qualitative experience in Medical and Diagnostic services with over 120 centers across Africa. The state-of-the art Diagnostic Centre represents a milestone towards fulfilling Clinix strategic objectives in providing a world class integrated health system that ensures excellence in health and healthcare for all as a globally recognized destination for healthcare. Clinix Healthcare Nigeria is the first investment in West Africa. The Principal investor is Greenlife Pharmaceuticals and Bliss Gvs Pharmaceuticals. Both companies have outstanding repute in the Nigerian Healthcare industry.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Officer

Job Location: Lagos

	Bachelor’s Degree in Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or a related field
	Strong expertise in Procurement, Purchasing, and managing Purchase Orders
	Proficiency in Contract Negotiation and handling supplier agreements
	Demonstrated Analytical Skills for assessing vendor performance and market trends
	Knowledge of supply chain processes and best procurement practices
	Excellent organizational, decision-making, and problem-solving abilities
	Background in healthcare procurement or related industries is highly advantageous.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: Admin@clinixhealthcare.com.ng , hr@clinixhealthcare.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: HR Generalist Job at Duob Recruitment
content:
Duob Recruitment, a recruitment firm, is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR Generalist

Job Location: Eti Osa, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Gender: Male (for team balance)

Job Summary


	The HR Generalist will be responsible for executing key human resource functions including recruitment, onboarding, employee relations, performance management, and HR administration.
	The ideal candidate will possess strong interpersonal skills, attention to detail, and a proactive approach to fostering a positive work culture.


Key Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Support end-to-end recruitment, onboarding, and exit processes.
	Maintain and update employee records and HR databases.
	Manage attendance, leave schedules, and performance documentation.
	Assist in the implementation of HR policies, initiatives, and engagement programs.
	Ensure compliance with company HR procedures and labor regulations.


Requirements & Skills


	Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, English, or a related field.
	2–3 years of proven HR experience in a structured organization.
	Strong communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office tools.
	Must reside within the Lekki/Ajah axis.


Salary
N200,000 – N250,000 monthly

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their resumes to: hrdamilolaasoat@outlook.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply
